cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 525 miles SE of Lake Charles, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest in the southeast Gulf, forecast to turn northwest and make landfall on the upper Texas / southwest Louisiana coast, then curve northeast across the lower Mississippi Valley and Ohio Valley before exiting off the Mid-Atlantic coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coast near the TX/LA border

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from east of Intracoastal City to west of Morgan City, Louisiana
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning San Luis Pass, TX to Intracoastal City, LA and Storm-Surge Warning San Luis Pass, TX to the Mouth of the Mississippi River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northwest Gulf Coast (Texas and Louisiana), then interior lower Mississippi Valley and Ohio Valley
weather_observation.wind: Remnant circulation may bring occasional gusts below tropical-storm force (generally <39 mph) late Friday into Saturday.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands from the remnant system could drop 1–2 inches of rain in southeast Michigan Friday night–Saturday, briefly reducing visibility and creating ponding on terminal surfaces.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Possible brief river‐level rises on the Detroit River/Lake St. Clair system affecting barge drafts, otherwise minimal direct tropical hazards expected.
